abstract.p: Mark Goldstein, chief marketing officer at Fallon Worldwide, will leave after 11 years to assume posts being created for him at units of Interpublic Group of Companies (S)

block.p: Mark Goldstein, chief marketing officer at Fallon Worldwide in Minneapolis, part of the Publicis Groupe, said yesterday that he would leave after 11 years to assume posts being created for him at units of the Interpublic Group of Companies in New York.

Effective June 2, Mr. Goldstein, 56, will become global chief marketing officer at Lowe & Partners Worldwide as well as at the Partnership division of Interpublic, which includes Lowe and agencies like Draft and Mullen.

Mark Goldstein, chief marketing officer at Fallon Worldwide in Minneapolis, part of the Publicis Groupe, said yesterday that he would leave after 11 years to assume posts being created for him at units of the Interpublic Group of Companies in New York.

Effective June 2, Mr. Goldstein, 56, will become global chief marketing officer at Lowe & Partners Worldwide as well as at the Partnership division of Interpublic, which includes Lowe and agencies like Draft and Mullen.

At Fallon, no successor has been chosen, said David Lubars, president and executive creative director for North America. Before Fallon, where Mr. Goldstein helped land clients like Citibank, Subway and United Airlines, he worked for agencies like Leo Burnett and Earle Palmer Brown.
